definition: to confer/to grant/to bestow a title/to seal/classifier for sealed objects, esp. letters
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: He got a large sum of hush money.
The media for their folly to question the imperial palace fee?
sentences.chinese: 媒體質疑故宮爲掩醜事給封口費？

sentences.english: Taking hush money from a gangster is dangerous.
sentences.chinese: 拿來自一個黑社會人士的封口費是很危險的。

sentences.english: They are bribing the reporters with hush money.
sentences.chinese: 他們用封口費賄賂記者。

sentences.english: To keep the scandal from coming out, the politician paid a lot of hush money .
sentences.chinese: 爲了防止醜聞外泄，政客付出大筆的封口費。
